message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "Using data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys and the International Labor Organization's Labor Force Survey, we investigate the relationship between firm productivity and job quality in Latin America.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys", "International Labor Organization's Labor Force Survey"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "We utilize cross-country panel data on monetary policy rules and measures of financial sector development from the World Bank to investigate the effects of banking sector development on the conduct of monetary policy in developing economies.", "dataset": ["World Bank"], "topic": ["Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "This study seeks to address these gaps by employing two complementary datasets related to foreign investment inflows and technical change: the UNCTAD database of bilateral FDI flows and the Global Patent Index.", "dataset": ["UNCTAD database of bilateral FDI flows", "Global Patent Index"], "topic": ["Competitiveness", "Digital Development"]}, {"sentence": "Using a nationally representative dataset of Indian households, we examine the relationship between consumption expenditure patterns and measures of financial inclusion available from the World Bank's Global Findex database.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Global Findex database"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "We use geocoded data on carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions from fossil fuel combustion released by the European Commission's Joint Research Centre, coupled with fine-grained data on energy infrastructure from various sources, to estimate the damages caused by extreme weather events on energy systems across Europe.", "dataset": ["European Commission's Joint Research Centre"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "By combining a proprietary dataset on online shopping transactions with publicly available data on physical store locations, we investigate the potential displacement effects of e-commerce on traditional retail stores in urban areas.", "dataset": ["proprietary dataset on online shopping transactions"], "topic": ["Urban Development", "Trade"]}, {"sentence": "We use panel data from the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys on manufacturing firms operating in Asia and sub-Saharan Africa, along with several measures of energy security from the International Energy Agency, to investigate the role of energy access in firm performance across different contexts.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys", "International Energy Agency"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the Humanitarian Data Exchange and the World Bank's Living Standards Measurement Study, we estimate the causal effects of conflict exposure on household welfare outcomes in Yemen.", "dataset": ["Humanitarian Data Exchange", "World Bank's Living Standards Measurement Study"], "topic": ["Fragility, Conflict, and Violence"]}, {"sentence": "We use survey data from multiple rounds of the Demographic and Health Surveys conducted in several Southeast Asian countries to examine the determinants of child stunting and wasting, focusing on factors related to maternal health behaviors.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys"], "topic": ["Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "To explore the role of cultural norms and beliefs in shaping political outcomes, we use a novel dataset consisting of tweets posted by elected officials in Latin America, collected over a period of several years using Twitter's streaming API.", "dataset": ["tweets posted by elected officials in Latin America"], "topic": ["Governance", "Social Sustainability and Inclusion"]}]
